body_html:
I got the same error.

  • This code produces ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence.
w = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.float32, name='w')
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w)
w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost, feed_dict={w: w1}))
  • This code (without using a placeholder) works
w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w1)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost))

Since I'm new to tensorflow, I'm leaning towards it's something I don't understand. I'm trying to keep the placeholder for easy feeding, but not sure how to do it.

This code produces ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence.

w = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.float32, name='w')
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w)
w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost, feed_dict={w: w1}))


This code (without using a placeholder) works

w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w1)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost))

Since I'm new to tensorflow, I'm leaning towards it's something I don't understand. I'm trying to keep the placeholder for easy feeding, but not sure how to do it.
body:
I got the same error.

- This code produces `ValueError: setting an array element with a sequence.`
```{python}
w = tf.placeholder(dtype=tf.float32, name='w')
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w)
w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost, feed_dict={w: w1}))
```
- This code (without using a placeholder) works
```{python}
w1 = tf.get_variable('w1', shape=[3, 4], initializer=tf.contrib.layers.xavier_initializer(seed=1188))
cost = tf.nn.l2_loss(w1)
init = tf.global_variables_initializer()

with tf.Session() as sess:
    sess.run(init)
    print(sess.run(cost))
```

Since I'm new to tensorflow, I'm leaning towards it's something I don't understand. I'm trying to keep the placeholder for easy feeding, but not sure how to do it.
